001
002package com.commercetools.docs.meta;
003
004/**
005 * {@include.toc}
006 * <h2 id=about-clients>About the client</h2>
007 *
008 * <p>The commercetools Composable Commerce client communicates asynchronously with the API via HTTPS
009 * and it takes care about authentication.</p>
010 *
011 * <p>The client uses Java objects to formulate an HTTP request, performs the request and
012 * maps the JSON response into a Java object. Since the client is thread-safe you need
013 * only one client to perform multiple requests in parallel.</p>
014 *
015 * <h3 id=instantiation>Instantiation</h3>
016 *
017 * <p>Creating an instance for a project:</p>
018 *
019 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#instance()}
020 *
021 * <h3 id=perform-requests>Performing requests</h3>
022 *
023 * <p>A client works on the abstraction level of one HTTP request.
024 * With one client you can start multiple requests in parallel, it is thread-safe.</p>
025 *
026 * <h4>Example</h4>
027 *
028 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#performRequest()}
029 *
030 * <h3 id=closing>Closing the client</h3>
031 *
032 * <p>The client holds resources like thread pools and IO connections, so call {@code close()} to release them.</p>
033 */
034public class GettingStarted {
035}
